title: Boxing news: Patrick Day 'undergoes emergency brain surgery' following a brutal KO
text:
The boxer is reportedly in a coma following an emergency operation on his brain

Boxer Patrick Day has reportedly undergone emergency brain surgery after suffering a seizure following a brutal knockout in bout against Charles Conwell.

Day was taken to a hospital after getting viciously knocked out in the 10th round by Conwell in Chicago on Saturday night.

According to ESPN, Day was in a coma after an emergency operation on his brain, although it is not known if it was medically induced.

Boxer Patrick Day (red shorts) has reportedly undergone emergency brain surgery after suffering a seizure following a brutal knockout in bout against Charles Conwell (black shorts)

Day was fighting at super welterweight on the undercard of Oleksandr Usyk's heavyweight debut win over Chazz Witherspoon by TKO.

Conwell landed a right hand early in the 10th. That caused Day to stumble and seconds later Conwell landed a left hook that knocked Day to the canvas.

Day, from Freeport, New York, was instantly knocked out and it wasn't clear if he regained consciousness.

He was treated by a doctor in the ring and then was rushed off on a stretcher by paramedics and transported to the hospital. Day was knocked down twice earlier in the fight.

Later, DAZN reported Day never regained consciousness and began having seizures when he entered the ambulance and he was using a breathing tube at the hospital.

'I had a chance to speak to the doctor, he told us Patrick never woke up on his way to the ambulance,' DAZN's Claudia Trejos said.

Day was taken to a hospital after getting viciously knocked out in the 10th round by Conwell

He was treated by a doctor in the ring and then was rushed off on a stretcher by paramedics

'He started seizing on his way to the ambulance, and he has been taken to hospital.

'Our thoughts and prayers are with Patrick Day and his family.'

Managing director of the promoter Matchroom Boxing Eddie Hearn, told iFL TV: 'Firstly, both guys are promoted by Lou DiBella so I've spoken to him and he will give everyone updates because I don't have the first-hand situation.

'It's not good. Obviously he was knocked unconscious in the last round of the fight and he was stretchered out into an ambulance really quickly.

'I followed him to the ambulance and he was still unconscious, went to the hospital with his corner team and his promoters, we're all praying for him.

Day's opponent Conwell tweeted shortly after the fight on Saturday: 'Praying for you!'

'It's a distressing situation, I'm sure there will be more updates int he next 24 hours from DiBella. I've seen some reports but my last conversation with Lou was that comments will be made by them.

'I don't want to speculate but he's extremely unwell. It's horrendous.

'My thoughts are with Patrick Day, his family, with Charles Conwell, with Lou DiBella, I'm just praying for him.'

Day's opponent Conwell tweeted shortly after the fight: 'Praying for you!'

He also told iFL TV: 'I give my blessings and concerns to Patrick Day, him and his team and his family. I hope that he is OK.'
description: Day was taken to a hospital after getting viciously knocked out in the 10th round by Conwell in Chicago on Saturday night. The 27-year-old was fighting at super welterweight.
